diff_hunk:
@@ -23,13 +23,8 @@ function bazel_clean_and_fetch() {
   # TODO(pcloudy): Re-enable it after bazel clean --expunge is fixed.
   if ! is_windows; then
     bazel clean --expunge
-    # TODO(https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/2220) Remove the nested `bazel query`.
-    bazel fetch $(bazel query "//tensorflow/... -//tensorflow/examples/android/...")
-  else
-    # TODO(pcloudy): Also filter out //tensorflow/examples/android/... on Windows after
-    # https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/2248 is fixed.
-    bazel fetch //tensorflow/...
   fi
+  bazel fetch "//tensorflow/... -//tensorflow/examples/android/..."
body: Yes, bazel fetch on an android_binary will intentionally fail if no android_sdk_repository is set up starting with the next Bazel release. I discussed the reasoning a bit in the Bazel issue associated with that commit.
body_html: Yes, bazel fetch on an android_binary will intentionally fail if no android_sdk_repository is set up starting with the next Bazel release. I discussed the reasoning a bit in the Bazel issue associated with that commit.
body_text: Yes, bazel fetch on an android_binary will intentionally fail if no android_sdk_repository is set up starting with the next Bazel release. I discussed the reasoning a bit in the Bazel issue associated with that commit.
